Alex Vlad (@vlladin) and Dan Goron (@Ox_Dan) are working on rainbow staking. I added Alex to this group, as well as shared an invite link to Dan.

I think this PR is meant to be a conversation starter. Alongside fast finality, rainbow staking is one of the key discussion topics for EF researchers in Cambridge during the retreat Oct 7-9.

I'm thinking of having a lean consensus call in November dedicated to rainbow staking. Until then my suggestion would be for PQ devnets to not worry too much about it :)

Yes, for now, we will not consider this in the first devnets (devnet 0 and 1 at least).

But I feel like it's good to have such primitives already, so we can get a head start on what's next. Something that could be nice is to start discussins/merging some primitives that don't affect the rest of the code, so we can start preparing and leave the field open for future modifications based on developments.

Small question: will this channel become the one for lean consensus interop discussions as a general rule (in which case it's relevant to discuss something other than post-quantum here), or is it intended solely for post-quantum matters?
